title: Rohingya mark two years of refugee crisis
desc: Two years after what the UN calls ethnic cleansing, refugees from Myanmar mark their "genocide day".

title: Hong Kong police fire tear gas in fresh clashes
desc: Police charge anti-government demonstrators, beating some with batons, in a 12th week of protests.

title: North Korea fires two more 'short-range missiles'
desc: South Korea says two more missiles - the seventh round in recent weeks - were fired early on Saturday.

title: China releases British consulate worker
desc: Simon Cheng was reported missing on 8 August after crossing the border for a business trip.

title: Former India finance minister Arun Jaitley dies
desc: Jaitley, 66, oversaw the most significant tax reform in India since independence.

title: Trump escalates China trade war with tariff hikes
desc: The president hits back at Beijing's plans by hiking tariffs on Chinese imports by another 5%.

title: Passengers angry at BA 'silence' amid strike chaos
desc: Customers say they are unable to get in touch with BA, as the airline says it is fielding 40,000 calls.

title: LA policeman who said sniper shot him 'made it up'
desc: Deputy Angel Reinosa cut two bullet holes in his shirt and called in to say he was "taking shots".

title: Israel says it struck Iranian drone sites in Syria
desc: In a rare acknowledgement, PM Benjamin Netanyahu says Israeli forces targeted "killer drones".

title: No-deal Brexit is now 'touch and go', says Johnson
desc: Boris Johnson previously said the chances of leaving without a deal were "a million to one".

title: Fines for Brazil environment crimes plummet
desc: The government is accused of ignoring illegal deforestation and burning in the Amazon.

title: Tusk and Johnson clash over who is 'Mr No Deal'
desc: The European Council president and the PM will meet at the G7 summit on Sunday to discuss Brexit.

title: Algeria minister quits after concert stampede
desc: Five young fans of popular French-based rapper Soolking were killed in a stadium in Algiers.

title: Six hurt after lightning strike at golf tournament
desc: The lightning hit a tree at the season-ending Tour Championship in Atlanta.

title: Huawei boss not a bargaining chip, says Pompeo
desc: Meng Wanzhou's lawyers argue her arrest is politically motivated, quoting President Trump's remarks.

title: YouTube shuts accounts over HK disinformation
desc: Following moves by Twitter and Facebook earlier this week, Google shuts down more than 200 YouTube channels.

title: China threatens sanctions over US-Taiwan arms deal
desc: The US government has approved the potential $8bn fighter plane sale, the largest in decades.

title: Florida 'stand your ground' killer convicted
desc: Michael Drejka had claimed self-defence when shooting an unarmed man in a parking dispute.

title: Breaking Bad: Trailer and date for El Camino film
desc: Netflix releases a trailer and date for the new movie, starring Aaron Paul.

title: Nasa 'probing first allegation of space crime'
desc: The space agency is reportedly looking into an allegation against astronaut Anne McClain.

title: First death linked to vaping reported in US
desc: The Illinois case comes as US health officials track 193 cases of a lung illness reported by vapers.

title: UK PM: US must compromise to get UK trade deal
desc: Boris Johnson and US President Donald Trump talk Brexit over breakfast during the G7 summit.

title: 3D scanners could end UK airport liquid restrictions
desc: Airports must introduce 3D baggage screening before the end of 2022, the government announces.

title: 'Our demand as women is not to be killed'
desc: Emine Bulut, 38, was stabbed to death in a cafe in Turkey by her ex-husband in front of her child.

title: EU nations to take in migrants stuck near Malta
desc: Six EU countries are to host 356 African migrants, who were stranded at sea for two weeks.

title: Russia floating nuclear power station sets sail
desc: The world's first such facility begins a long voyage across the Arctic ocean to Russia's far east.

title: France launches rape inquiry in Epstein case
desc: The financier, who was facing sex charges in the US when he killed himself, had a home in Paris.

title: Russia medics fear nuclear blast contamination
desc: Arctic hospital staff did not know that military test victims were irradiated, the BBC learns.

title: Qantas to run test flights on world's longest route
desc: The airline will track the health impacts of the 19-hour journeys from Sydney to New York and London.

title: How Australia is shaking up the truffle market
desc: Australia maybe a newcomer in growing black truffles but is now the world's fourth-largest producer.
